meanings.definition: To divide or distribute something again
meanings.sent1: After the meeting, they decided to repartition the tasks among the team members.
meanings.sent2: The teacher had to repartition the candies equally among the students.
meanings.sent3: The chef had to repartition the cake slices to make sure everyone got a fair share.
meanings.sent4: The puzzle pieces were repartitioned to create a new challenge for the players.
meanings.sent5: The company decided to repartition the office space for better organization.

meanings.definition: The act of redistributing something, especially wealth or resources
meanings.sent1: The repartitions of land among the villagers led to a more equitable distribution.
meanings.sent2: Government policies aimed at fair repartitions of wealth are crucial for social balance.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected repartitions of snacks at the party caused some confusion among the guests.
meanings.sent4: The repartitions of responsibilities in the team resulted in a more efficient workflow.
meanings.sent5: The repartitions of resources among the departments were carefully planned to avoid shortages.
